arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich lauds Bayern Munich in “win of mentality” against SC Freiburg
arts.sum: However, over the past few seasons it seems Bayern have somewhat lost the killer mentality so often associated with the German club. We’ve played better games before, but today’s win does us a lot of good,” said Kimmich in characterizing how Bayern ended up triumphant on the day (as captured by @iMiaSanMia ).

arts.ttl: They’re back! Vincent Kompany celebrates Josip Stanišić, João Palhinha return for Bayern Munich
arts.sum: A bright spot in Bayern Munich ’s 2-1 win over SC Freiburg: the return of defender Josip Stanišić and midfielder João Palhinha from the injury list. We’re very happy with our squad.”

arts.ttl: Josip Stanišić chooses to remain positive about Bayern Munich’s narrow win over SC Freiburg
arts.sum: Bayern Munich responded to its shocking 3-0 defeat to Feyenoord in the Champions League with a drab 2-1 Bundesliga win over Freiburg. After the match, the holding champion spoke about the victory (as captured via @iMiaSanMia ), saying, “Freiburg is the second-best home team in the league.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich grateful for Harry Kane even when he's not scoring
arts.sum: Kimmich lauded Kane on Saturday after the England star helped Bayern open a six-point lead at the top of the Bundesliga with a battling performance in a 2-1 win at Freiburg. Don’t measure Harry Kane by his goals for Bayern Munich, teammate Joshua Kimmich says.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s tight 1-2 victory against SC Freiburg
arts.sum: Playing away at Freiburg, the Bayern squad fought their way against a steely opposition to continue their 5 game winning streak in the league. After stopping Bayern from increasing their lead, Ginter went on to score for Freiburg in the 68th minute with a deft header, giving the home team a splendid fighting chance that Freiburg ultimately failed to capitalize on.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany grateful for Bayern Munich’s away victory over SC Freiburg
arts.sum: Bayern Munich managed to leave Freiburg with all three points after a long week of football. Vincent Kompany: "It may not have been our best game, but it's one of the best wins because we know how difficult it is here in Freiburg against the second-placed team at home.

arts.ttl: Four Observations from Bayern Munich’s uneventful 2-1 win against SC Freiburg
arts.sum: Bayern Munich scraped together a win against a tough SC Freiburg side thanks to a Harry Kane goal from open play (yes, you read that right) and a cheeky Kim Min-jae header following a magnificent Joshua Kimmich corner. The second half was a little more open but allowed for Freiburg to have their chances at the Bayern goal.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich secure narrow win over Freiburg
arts.sum: A brilliant Harry Kane goal and Minjae Kim header proved enough to see Bayern to their fifth consecutive Bundesliga win at a battling Freiburg side as Vincent Kompany's men moved six points clear at the top of the table. Minjae Kim rises highest to head home Bayern's second goal from a corner kick.

arts.ttl: Kane scores from open play as Bayern Munich goes 6 points clear in Bundesliga
arts.sum: Harry Kane scored for the first time from open play since November and Bayern Munich stretched its Bundesliga lead to six points by winning in Freiburg 2-0 on Saturday. Kane had scored only two penalties in the six Bundesliga games since.

arts.ttl: Breaking: Leon Goretzka becomes latest Bayern Munich player felled by injury
arts.sum: The injury comes at a bad time for the Bayern munich midfielder, who was making a lot of progress in recent weeks and had broken into Vincent Kompany’s starting XI: Hamstring injury for Leon Goretzka pic.twitter.com/CC8MRiFFsX
